snippet.title: CNET News Video
snippet.description: From industry news to techy trends to newsmaker interviews, no technology angle is too small or obsc

snippet.title: Kobe, Lakers, and Dwight Howard: Antisocial media
snippet.description: The minute Dwight Howard decides to leave the Lakers for Houston, he is unfollowed on Twitter by Kobe Bryant. Then an Instagram account purporting to be that of the Lakers' Jodie Meeks posts a pic of Howard as a woman.

snippet.title: Circa News (Android)
snippet.description: Circa is a fantastic free tool for reading breaking news and staying informed wherever you are.

snippet.title: Bing News
snippet.description: A pleasing design and stable performance make Bing News a must-have free app to effortlessly keep up with the news.

snippet.title: Facebook Paper
snippet.description: Facebook's Paper is a new and attractive way to browse the social network and get the latest news, but its unclear why it's better to have two Facebook apps rather than one.

snippet.title: Material for Android
snippet.description: Material could one day be a great, simpler alternative to Flipboard, but first it has to fix its performance issues.

snippet.title: Kobe plays shooting guard in new Call Of Duty ad
snippet.description: The launch ad for "Call of Duty: Black Ops" sees people in their everyday clothes shooting people with everyday guns. Among them are Kobe Bryant and Jimmy Kimmel.

snippet.title: Yahoo for Android
snippet.description: More than just a news app, Yahoo stands out for its customization and search tools.

snippet.title: Intel's Bryant set to become chairman
snippet.description: Intel says Andy Bryant has become vice chairman and will become its new chairman in May of next year.

snippet.title: The Daily Planet for iOS
snippet.description: If you want a no-nonsense news app, The Daily Planet has a ton of categories to browse from thousands of sources and a simple navigation system that helps you get to the news you want to read quickly.
